member.name: T:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DefaultDragHandler
member.summary: The default drag handler for GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DefaultDropHandler
member.summary: A default insertion drop handler for the most common usages

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DefaultDropHandler.CanAcceptData(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo)
member.summary: Test the specified drop information for the right data.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DefaultDropHandler.SelectDroppedItems(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clears the current selected items and selects the given items.
member.param: The items which should be select.
if set to true then for all items the ApplyTemplate will be invoked.
if set to true the visual target will be focused.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DefaultDropHandler.ShouldCopyData(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo)
member.summary: Determines whether the data of the drag drop action should be copied otherwise moved.
member.param: The DropInfo with a valid DragInfo.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragDrop.TryGetDragHandler(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo,System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the drag handler from the drag info or from the sender, if the drag info is null
member.param: the sender from an event, e.g. mouse down, mouse move

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragDrop.TryGetDropHandler(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo,System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the drop handler from the drop info or from the sender, if the drop info is null
member.param: the sender from an event, e.g. drag over

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragDrop.TryGetDragInfoBuilder(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the drag info builder from the sender.
member.param: the sender from an event, e.g. drag over

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragDrop.TryGetDropInfoBuilder(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the drop info builder from the sender.
member.param: the sender from an event, e.g. drag over

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragDrop.TryGetRootElementFinder(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the RootElementFinder from the sender or uses the default implementation, if it's null.
member.param: the sender from an event, e.g. drag over

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragInfo
member.summary: Holds information about a the source of a drag drop operation.
member.remarks: The class holds all of the framework's information about the source of a drag. It is used by to determine whether a drag can start, and what the dragged data should be.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DragInfo.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButton,System.Func{System.Windows.IInputElement,System.Windows.Point})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DragInfo class.
member.param: The sender of the input event that initiated the drag operation.
The original source of the input event.
The mouse button which was used for the drag operation.
A function of the input event which is used to get drag position points.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DropInfo
member.summary: Holds information about a the target of a drag drop operation.
member.remarks: The class holds all of the framework's information about the current target of a drag. It is used by method to determine whether the current drop target is valid, and by to perform the drop.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DropInfo.TargetScrollViewer
member.summary: Gets the ScrollViewer control for the visual target.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DropInfo.TargetScrollingMode
member.summary: Gets or Sets the ScrollingMode for the drop action.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DropInfo class.
member.param: The sender of the drop event.
Information about the drag source, if the drag came from within the framework.
The type of the underlying event (tunneled or bubbled).

member.summary: Gets or Sets the pen which can be used for the render process.

member.summary: Gets the type of the default highlight target adorner.

member.summary: Gets the type of the default insert target adorner.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DropTargetHighlightAdorner.OnRender(System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, participates in rendering operations that are directed by the layout system. The rendering instructions for this element are not used directly when this method is invoked, and are instead preserved for later asynchronous use by layout and drawing.
member.param: The drawing instructions for a specific element. This context is provided to the layout system.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.DropTargetInsertionAdorner.OnRender(System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, participates in rendering operations that are directed by the layout system. The rendering instructions for this element are not used directly when this method is invoked, and are instead preserved for later asynchronous use by layout and drawing.
member.param: The drawing instructions for a specific element. This context is provided to the layout system.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.ICloneableDragItem
member.summary: Supports cloning like the ICloneable interface, which creates a new instance of a class with the same value as an existing instance.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.ICloneableDragItem.CloneItem(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo)
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
member.param: Object which contains several drop information.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.summary: Creates a custom cursor.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.DataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the data format which will be used for the drag and drop actions.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the drag data.
member.remarks: This must be set by a drag handler in order for a drag to start.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.DragStartPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the click that initiated the drag, relative to .

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.PositionInDraggedItem
member.summary: Gets the point where the cursor was relative to the item being dragged when the drag was started.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.Effects
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed effects for the drag.
member.remarks: This must be set to a value other than by a drag handler in order for a drag to start.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.MouseButton
member.summary: Gets the mouse button that initiated the drag.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.SourceCollection
member.summary: Gets the collection that the source ItemsControl is bound to.
member.remarks: If the control that initiated the drag is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be null.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.SourceIndex
member.summary: Gets the position from where the item was dragged.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.SourceItem
member.summary: Gets the object that a dragged item is bound to.
member.remarks: If the control that initiated the drag is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be null.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.SourceItems
member.summary: Gets a collection of objects that the selected items in an ItemsControl are bound to.
member.remarks: If the control that initiated the drag is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be empty.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.SourceGroup
member.summary: Gets the group from a dragged item if the drag is currently from an ItemsControl with groups.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.VisualSource
member.summary: Gets the control that initiated the drag.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.VisualSourceItem
member.summary: Gets the item in an ItemsControl that started the drag.
member.remarks: If the control that initiated the drag is an ItemsControl, this property will hold the item container of the clicked item. For example, if is a ListBox this will hold a ListBoxItem.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.VisualSourceFlowDirection
member.summary: Gets the FlowDirection of the current drag source.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.DataObject
member.summary: Gets the which is used by the drag and drop operation. Set it to a custom instance if custom drag and drop behavior is needed.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.DragDropHandler
member.summary: Initiates a drag-and-drop operation.
member.param: A reference to the dependency object that is the source of the data being dragged.
A data object that contains the data being dragged.
One of the values that specifies permitted effects of the drag-and-drop operation.
member.returns: One of the values that specifies the final effect that was performed during the drag-and-drop operation.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo.DragDropCopyKeyState
member.summary: Gets the drag drop copy key state indicating the effect of the drag drop operation.

member.summary: Interface implemented by Drag Info Builders. It enables custom construction of DragInfo objects to support 3rd party controls like DevExpress, Telerik, etc.

The original source of the input event.
The mouse button which was used for the drag operation.
A function of the input event which is used to get drag position points.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource
member.summary: Interface implemented by Drag Handlers.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource.StartDrag(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo)
member.summary: Queries whether a drag can be started.
member.param: Object which contains several drag information.
member.remarks: To allow a drag to be started, the property on should be set to a value other than .

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource.CanStartDrag(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance [can start drag] the specified drag information. With this action it's possible to check if the drag and drop operation is allowed to start e.g. check for a UIElement inside a list view item, that should not start a drag and drop operation
member.param: Object which contains several drag information.
member.returns: True if the drag and drop operation is allowed.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource.Dropped(GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo)
member.summary: Notifies the drag handler that a drop has occurred.
member.param: Object which contains several drop information.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource.DragDropOperationFinished(System.Windows.DragDropEffects,GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragInfo)
member.summary: Notifies the drag handler that a drag and drop operation has finished.
member.param: Object which contains several drag information.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource.DragCancelled
member.summary: Notifies the drag handler that a drag has been aborted.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDragSource.TryCatchOccurredException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Notifies that an exception has occurred upon dragging.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether the exception is handled in the drag handler. False will rethrow the exception.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.Data
member.summary: Gets the drag data.
member.remarks:
If the drag came from within the framework, this will hold:
- The dragged data if a single item was dragged. - A typed IEnumerable if multiple items were dragged.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.DragInfo
member.summary: Gets a object holding information about the source of the drag, if the drag came from within the framework.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.DropPosition
member.summary: Gets the mouse position relative to the VisualTarget

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.DropTargetAdorner
member.summary: Gets or sets the class of drop target to display.
member.remarks: The standard drop target Adorner classes are held in the class.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.Effects
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed effects for the drop.
member.remarks: This must be set to a value other than by a drop handler in order for a drop to be possible.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.InsertIndex
member.summary: Gets the current insert position within .

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.UnfilteredInsertIndex
member.summary: Gets the current insert position within the source (unfiltered) .
member.remarks: This should be only used in a Drop action. This works only correct with different objects (string, int, etc won't work correct).

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.TargetCollection
member.summary: Gets the collection that the target ItemsControl is bound to.
member.remarks: If the current drop target is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be null.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.TargetItem
member.summary: Gets the object that the current drop target is bound to.
member.remarks: If the current drop target is unbound or not an ItemsControl, this will be null.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.TargetGroup
member.summary: Gets the current group target.
member.remarks: If the drag is currently over an ItemsControl with groups, describes the group that the drag is currently over.

member.summary: Gets the ScrollViewer control for the visual target.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the ScrollingMode for the drop action.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.VisualTarget
member.summary: Gets the control that is the current drop target.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.VisualTargetItem

member.summary: Gets the orientation of the current drop target.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.IDropInfo.VisualTargetFlowDirection

The scale factor in the x dimension
The scale factor in the y dimension

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.Utilities.HitTestUtilities.IsNotPartOfSender(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary:
thx to @osicka from issue #84
e.g. original source is part of a popup (e.g. ComboBox drop down), the hit test needs to be done on the original source. Because the popup is not attached to the visual tree of the sender. This function test this by looping back from the original source to the sender and if it didn't end up at the sender stopped the drag.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.Utilities.ItemsControlExtensions.GetItemsPanelOrientation(System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Gets the Orientation which will be used for the drag drop action. Normally it will be look up to find the correct orientation of the inner ItemsPanel, but sometimes it's necessary to force the orientation, if the look up is wrong. If so, the ItemsPanelOrientation value is taken.
member.param: The ItemsControl for the look up.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Wpf.DragDrop.Utilities.VisualTreeExtensions.GetVisibleDescendantBounds(System.Windows.Media.Visual)
member.summary: GetVisibleDescendantBounds returns the union of all of the content bounding boxes of the specified Visual's sub-graph. It's a work around of VisualTreeHelper.GetDescendantBounds() including collapsed Visuals in its bounds calculations.
